plant-info.plant-description: Turnips are a root vegetable commonly grown in temperate climates worldwide for its white, bulbous taproot. Small, tender varieties are grown for human consumption, while larger varieties are grown as feed for livestock.

planting-details.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.
planting-details.water: Regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
planting-details.planting-instructions: Sow seeds 1/2 inch deep and 1 inch apart in rows 12 inches apart. Thin to 4 inches apart once the seedlings are 4 inches tall.
planting-details.care-instructions: Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged. Apply a balanced organic fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
planting-details.harvest-instructions: Harvest turnips when they are 2-3 inches in diameter for the best flavor and texture. Larger turnips tend to become woody and strong in flavor.
